hints.content:

Point $A$ tells us a city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.

question.content:

choices.content: A city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.
A city $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level is $5 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero.

The temperature in the city with an elevation of $-9 \text{ m}$ was $7 ^{\circ}\text{C}$.

hints.content:
The $\green{\text{library}}$ is $5$ units from the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c38c140acd332e5cdfc10345314a12d320cb4a02)

The $\pink{\text{school}}$ is located at $(6,0)$, *not* $(0,6)$.


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/82d0d615aaa10ad6ccb3cd0adcc153e1d33ba8b8)

The library is $5$ units from the $y$-axis: **True**

The school is located at $(0,6)$: **False**

question.content:
Kennan graphed the location of several places in his town on the coordinate plane shown below.

**Determine if each statement about Kennan's graph is true or false.**

[[☃ categorizer 1]]

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3330899e6e60dddfc104cac49f2714ad8a88e575)

items: The library is $5$ units from the $y$-axis.

hints.content:
Art is $\pink{14}$ units from the $\pink{\text{library}}$ and $\purple6$ units from $\purple{\text{science}}$.


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b13a90f06bc2b921226fc0b3f1660216f556b8de)

$\purple6<\pink{14}$, so art is closer to $\purple{\text{science}}$, *not*  the $\pink{\text{library}}$.

The $\green{\text{cafeteria}}$ is located at $(-7,9)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/943a6d0d338bb1489f7d21c21f17985439a20824)

Art is closer to the library than to science: **False**

The cafeteria is located at $(-7,9)$: **True**

So, the $\green{\text{ice cream shop}}$ will be $\dfrac{8}{2} = 4$ units away from both the $\pink{\text{school}}$ and $\purple{\text{hospital}}$.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/03a3f753f6b038e78f45dac9387405003d69024a)
Mei should graph the ice cream shop at coordinates $(6,-4)$.

hints.content:
Paulo's commute time was $18$ minutes $9$ days ago, and his commute time was $24$ minutes $8$ days ago.

The difference is $24-18=6$ minutes.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2513a4e25eddc991ad9dda5b505c4d3042b3e8db)

So, $2$ days ago, the commute time was $\dfrac{6}{2}=3$ minutes away from both $(-2,24)$ and $(-2,18)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0ef162030d940d90210fccdedbe80b0c3e8d3459)
Paulo should graph his commute time $2$ days ago at $(-2, 21)$.

question.content:
Paulo tracks his commute time. The coordinate plane below shows some of his commute times in the last two weeks. The $x$-axis of the graph represents the number of days before today. For example, $-1$ would represent yesterday. The $y$-axis represents the commute time in minutes.

$2$ days ago, Paulo's commute time was halfway between his commute times $8$ and $9$ days ago.

**At what coordinates should Paulo graph his commute time $2$ days ago?**

 $($[[☃ input-number 1]]$,\,$[[☃ input-number 2]]$)$



![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ddb639f3c323903854639ae5a99effef10b6299d)

hints.content:
At $2 \text{ p.m.}$, the temperature is $7$ degrees Celsius

At $8 \text{ p.m.}$, the temperature is $-3$ degrees Celsius.

The difference is $7-(-3)=10$ degrees Celsius.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/dd4e5e90d0ec4e50da689aa22ed2717137c33012)

So, at $5 \text{ p.m.}$, the temperature is $\dfrac{10}{2}=5$ degrees Celsius away from both $(5,7)$ and $(5,-3)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/64fc1b129cafb668b8c3d910720f4cfa35e237f1)
$(5,2)$ represents the temperature at $5 \text{ p.m.}$

question.content:
The temperatures at several times of the day are shown in the coordinate plane below. The $x$-axis represents the number of hours before or after noon.   For example, $-1$ would represent $11 \text{ a.m.}$ The $y$-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius.

At $5 \text{ p.m.}$, the temperature is halfway between the temperature at $2 \text{ p.m.}$ and the temperature at $8 
\text{ p.m.}$ 

**What coordinates represent the temperature at $5 \text{ p.m.}$ ?**  

 $($[[☃ input-number 1]]$,\,$[[☃ input-number 2]]$)$



![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/857f4c6476132285c79f37c2142b62f6ec320aef)

hints.content:
An $x$-value of $4$ represents July $4$th. The point $(4,3)$ has the largest $y$-value out of all points shown, which means it represents the highest net electricity use.

Therefore, the statement "the highest net electricity use occurred on July $4$th" is true.

An $x$-value of $2$ represents July $2$nd. The coordinates of the point are $(2,0)$, not $(2,-1)$.

Therefore, the statement "the net electricity use on July $2$nd is represented by $(2,-1)$"  is false.

The highest net electricity use occurred on July $4$th: **True**

The net electricity use on July $2$nd is represented by $(2,-1)$: **False**

question.content:
Aditya installed solar panels for her house. When the solar panels produce more electricity than Aditya uses in a day, her *net electricity use* is negative.

The graph below shows Aditya's net electricity use in the first week of July. The $x$-axis represents days in July, and the $y$-axis represents net electricity use in kilowatt-hours ($\text{kWh}$).

**Determine if each statement about the graph is true or false.**

[[☃ categorizer 1]]

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/37cd1af57ca87cf75d967f826fba9cacb90da57e)

items: The highest net electricity use occurred on July $4$th.
The net electricity use on July $2$nd is represented by $(2,-1)$.

hints.content:
An elevation of $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level would be to the right of the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d2cdfd8b3c14c0d40f4a7d72004b1d79dd33ca08)

A temperature of $9 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero would be below the $x$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b1b0720312d970c669c8c9cf756c540792e0ecee)

The point shows the coordinates $(6, -9)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/221f68fd637dbdbc96b09c77c11f60ef1c5854a0)
The point showing a city $6 \text{ m}$ *above* sea level and $9 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero is in $\text{Quadrant IV}$.

question.content:
Alan graphed the relationship between temperature and elevation for several cities. The $x$-coordinate is the elevation in meters and the $y$-coordinate is the temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff) 

**Which quadrant would contain a point showing a city $6 \text{ m}$ above sea level and $9 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ below zero?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
An elevation of $3 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level would be to the left of the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/cc1dce45666f4ce39d093f15c546d8180b70b091)

A temperature of $6 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero would be below the $x$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b1b0720312d970c669c8c9cf756c540792e0ecee)

The point shows the coordinates $(-3, -6)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/e9955cdec819f4055a4882e9d26540463865c897)
The point showing a city $3 \text{ m}$ *below* sea level and $6 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero is in $\text{Quadrant III}$.

question.content:
Armando graphed the relationship between temperature and elevation for several cities. The $x$-coordinate is the elevation in meters and the  the $y$-coordinate is the  temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff) 

**Which quadrant would contain the point showing a city $3 \text{ m}$ below sea level and $6 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ below zero?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
An elevation *above* sea level would be to the right of the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d2cdfd8b3c14c0d40f4a7d72004b1d79dd33ca08)

Any point that has a positive $x$-coordinate represents a city above sea level.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/09698054e1bf94486d058d2dac680e7321c8b6c9)
The points showing a city *above* sea level are in $\text{Quadrant I}$ and $\text{Quadrant IV}$.

question.content:
Elise graphed the relationship between temperature and elevation for several cities. The $x$-coordinate is the elevation in meters and the $y$-coordinate is the  temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff) 

**Which quadrants could contain a point showing a city above sea level?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
An temperature of $8 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero would be to the right of the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/19fffa2fadda56cb1d6d9cfc75739d874c765d65)

An *increase* of $4$ people sledding would be above  the $x$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/760aef82d624cd1a99052e55895fec06d9998bfc)

The point shows the coordinates $(8,4)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/9acbb7d9f2111c279ba9fb52e48f6bba5404255d)
The point showing a temperature  $8 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero and an *increase* of $4$ people sledding is in $\text{Quadrant I}$.

question.content:
Lucy graphed the relationship between the temperature and the change in the number of people sledding at a park. 

The $x$-coordinate is the  temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$ and the $y$-coordinate  is the change in the number of people who are sledding.





![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff) 

**Which quadrant would contain the point showing $8 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *above* zero and an *increase* of $4$ people sledding?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
An temperature of $2 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero would be to the left of the $y$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3b928804a388d41660a190e53fcb3851cc86ae30)

A *decrease* of $7$ people sledding would be below the $x$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/03afa0994d93ad66a366cb45caa2980508771414)

The point shows the coordinates $(-2, -7)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ebdbb8785600eb46c074efb1e8d619585e4440fd)
The point showing a temperature  $2 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero and a *decrease* of $7$ people sledding is in $\text{Quadrant III}$.

question.content:
Juan graphed the relationship between the temperature and the change in the number of people sledding at a park. 

The $x$-coordinate is the  temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$ and the $y$-coordinate  is the change in the number of people who are sledding.





![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff) 

**Which quadrant could contain a point showing $2 ^{\circ}\text{C}$ *below* zero and a *decrease* of $7$ people sledding?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
A *decrease* in the number of  people sledding would be below the $x$-axis.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5e5d12961d1d8e95c684833e705822cde9e5c4bf)

Any point that has a negative $y$-coordinate represents a *decrease* in the number of people sledding

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0a89a9edf4c43a55b99cc9537f2255cc979fee57)
The points showing a *decrease* in the number of people sledding are in $\text{Quadrant III}$ and $\text{Quadrant IV}$.

question.content:
Jerome graphed the relationship between the temperature and the change in the number of people sledding at a park. 

The $x$-coordinate is the  temperature in $^{\circ}\text{C}$ and the $y$-coordinate  is the change in the number of people who are sledding.





![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b9646357f8af86eb1ec25bc0baf6620465223ff)
